==History==
==History==
â
[[Image:MellowTouch.jpg|thumb|left|Mellow Touch (late 1990s - 2004) {{deletable image-caption}}]]The station began broadcasts in 1973 (when the Philippines was under Martial Law) as DWLL-FM, The Mellow Touch, one of the pioneer FM stations that do not have [[disc jockeys]] in their programming that rely entirely on taped voiceover (now the famous television newscaster [[Mike Enriquez]]{{Fact|date=March 2007}}) to segue between songs.
+
The station began broadcasts in 1973 (when the Philippines was under Martial Law) as DWLL-FM, The Mellow Touch, one of the pioneer FM stations that do not have [[disc jockeys]] in their programming that rely entirely on taped voiceover (now the famous television newscaster [[Mike Enriquez]]{{Fact|date=March 2007}}) to segue between songs.
Mellow Touch's predominantly easy listening format gradually went down with the restoration of democratic rule in 1986, until just over 5 years ago, it started to accommodate on-air jocks and began to play largely pop alternative songs in-between the standard love songs. Today, to emphasize this shift in programming, it has changed their station title to just plain Mellow 947 ("ninety-four-seven"). Its programs now generally aim to bring out the mellow side of rock music fans.

Today, to emphasize this shift in programming, it has changed their station title to just plain Mellow 947 ("ninety-four-seven"). Its programs now generally aim to bring out the mellow side of rock music fans.
